result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A. Goodell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana gives status of pending motion.  Switching of the pleas would be appropriate and all parties are in agreement.  PSI would work for either case due to both cases are similar in fact.  State does not object to switching the pleas.  14CF317 would then remain open.  Court grants motion to withdraw the plea in 14CF317 and State moves to dismiss/read in.
Motion hearing at 07-09-2015 01:00 pm
for plea withdrawal

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana request bond modification.  Delay due to PSI.  Cash bonded is what is holding defendant.  14CF371 bond is $1000 and 14CF274 bond is $5000.00.  Attorney Masana request modification if the cash bond.  State objects to any bond modifications.  Attorney Masana addresses age of defendant.  No flight risk.  Would have residency with his mother.  Would like to seek employment.  Court agrees matter should have been resolved by now, however denies motion to modify bond in either case.
for bond modification
Sentencing hearing at 07-13-2015 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 07-13-2015 01:30 pm
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states all matters are resolved and states agreement.  PSI to be requested w/parties free to argue at sentencing but the State agrees to not recommend a prison sentence.  State is in agreement.  Atty Masana enters NC pleas to Ct 1 in 14CF274 and Ct 1 in 14CF317.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State explains to court that not all victims had notice as two of the cases were not on her calendar for today.  Recess for State to see if victim is available.  Back on the record the State notes they were unable to get ahold of the victim in 14CF274.  They will email the victim and notice her of the SEH so the DE can get started on the PSI.  Court will proceed today.  PSI is ordered.  To be completed not later than 4/30/2015.

14CF274
Ct 1:  NC
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

14CF317
Ct 1:  NC

14CM561 and 14CF335 are both dismissed/read-in  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on March 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information/waives reading/stands mute to both counts.  Court advises DE of charges/maximum penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continued in 14CF335.  14CF317 and 14CM561 are to be set for trial also.  Bonds continued in all matters.
Hearing on December 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes there are 5 cases in total.  Atty Masana states none of the matters are resolved and requests matters be set for JT.  All prelims have been waived and arraignments done.  State notes no prelim held yet in 14CF335.  Atty Masana requests prelim hearing in 14CF335 only.  All others have been waived already.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bonds continue in all matters.
Return date on November 18, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Brandon A. Goodell in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brandon A. Goodell appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/children in complaint BMM & MLG; No contact w/any female under the age of 18.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.
